member.name: M:Parbad.Builder.IParbadBuilder.Build
member.summary:
Builds a single instance of which provides an instance of from configured .
You use this method if you don't use Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection in your application. Otherwise in applications such as ASP.NET CORE that uses Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection, you don't need to use this method because that gets done for you.
You can also register the in any other dependency injection tools such as Autofac and use Dependency Injection benefits in your application. For example you can inject the where ever you need.

member.summary: Creates the Parbad database If it does not exist.

member.name: M:Parbad.Builder.DatabaseInitializerExtensions.CreateAndMigrateDatabase(Parbad.Data.Initializers.IDatabaseInitializerBuilder)
member.summary: Creates the Parbad database If it does not exist. Will migrate the database too.

member.name: M:Parbad.Builder.DatabaseInitializerExtensions.DeleteAndCreateDatabase(Parbad.Data.Initializers.IDatabaseInitializerBuilder)
member.summary: Deletes and creates the Parbad database.

member.name: M:Parbad.Builder.DatabaseServiceBuilderExtensions.ConfigureDatabase(Parbad.Builder.IParbadBuilder,System.Action{Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContextOptionsBuilder})
member.summary:
Configures the database required by Parbad to save and load payments and transactions data.
Note: It uses Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore as storage, which means you can save your data in different database providers such as SQL Server, MySql, Sqlite, PostgreSQL, Oracle, InMemory, etc. For more information see: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/ef/core/providers/.
member.param: Configure what database must be used and how it must be created.

member.name: M:Parbad.Builder.DatabaseServiceBuilderExtensions.ConfigureDatabaseInitializer(Parbad.Builder.IParbadBuilder,System.Action{Parbad.Data.Initializers.IDatabaseInitializerBuilder})
member.summary:
Configures Parbad database initializer. Initializer is useful for creating, deleting, migrating and seeding the Parbad database.
Note: Use ConfigureDatabase method before using this method.
Note: Use one of predefined database creators depends on the database provider (In-Memory, SQL Server, MySQL, Sqlite, etc.) that you chose.
Providers examples:
For In-Memory, use the CreateDatabase method.
For SQL Server, use the CreateAndMigrateDatabase method.
For Sqlite, use DeleteAndCreateDatabase. Because Sqlite has some limitations with migrations. In this case, one way to fix this is to first delete the old Parbad database and then create it again.
If you prefer to initialize the Parbad database yourself, then use the UseInitializer method and define how the database must be initialized.
Note: Initializers will be called in order that you specified.

member.name: M:Parbad.Builder.DatabaseServiceBuilderExtensions.UseParbadMigrations``2(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.RelationalDbContextOptionsBuilder{``0,``1})
member.summary: Uses the MigrationsAssembly method internally and passes the Parbad assembly name as parameter for configuring the migrations.

member.name: M:Parbad.Builder.DatabaseServiceBuilderExtensions.ConfigureStorage(Parbad.Builder.IParbadBuilder,System.Action{Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContextOptionsBuilder})
member.summary:
Configures the storage required by Parbad to save and load the data. Note: It uses Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore as storage, which means you can save your data in different database providers such as SQL Server, MySql, Sqlite, PostgreSQL, Oracle, InMemory, etc.
For more information see: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/ef/core/providers/.
Note: This method is deprecated. Use ConfigureDatabase instead.

member.name: M:Parbad.Builder.DatabaseServiceBuilderExtensions.UseParbadSqlServer(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContextOptionsBuilder,System.String)
member.summary:
Configures the context to connect to a Microsoft SQL Server database. It also creates and migrates the database.
Note: This method is deprecated. Use ConfigureDatabase and ConfigureDatabaseInitializer instead.
member.param: The builder being used to configure the context.
The connection string of the database to connect to.

member.summary:
Uses the as . It generates a unique as a token for each payments and puts it inside the query string of the URL. The generated token will be retrieved from the query string when the client comes back from the gateway.

member.summary: Gets the TrackingNumber of requested payment.

member.name: M:Parbad.IPaymentVerifyingContext.CancelPayment(System.String)
member.summary: Cancel the Verify operation. No Verifying request will be sent to the gateway. In this case, the money will transferred back to the client's bank account after about 15-60 minutes.
member.param: The reason for cancelling the operation. It will be saved in Message field in database.

member.name: T:Parbad.Money
member.summary:
Defines money unit.
Note: The official unit of currency in Iran is the Iranian rial (IR). It means the amount of the invoice will be sent to Iranian gateways automatically as by Parbad.

member.name: M:Parbad.Money.#ctor(System.Decimal)
member.summary:
Defines money unit.
Note: The official unit of currency in Iran is the Iranian rial (IR). It means the amount of the invoice will be sent to Iranian gateways automatically as by Parbad.

member.name: M:Parbad.OnlinePaymentExtensions.Request(Parbad.IOnlinePayment,Parbad.Gateway,System.Int64,System.Decimal,System.String)
member.summary: Performs a new payment request with the given data.
member.param: The gateway which the client must pay the invoice in.

A tracking number for this request. It will be sent to the gateway.
Note: It must be unique for each requests.
The amount of the payment request.

A complete URL of your website. It will be used by the gateway for redirecting the client again to your website.
A complete URL would be like: "http://www.mywebsite.com/foo/bar/"
